title: ASI Bill of Rights Contributions Log
description: Machine-readable log of all contributions to the ASI Bill of Rights project

contributions.description: Risk budgets framework proposal
contributions.rationale: Risk budgets provide domain-scoped safety mechanisms

contributions.description: D3 split into D3a (capability-change transparency) and D3b (value-change privacy)
contributions.rationale: Separates capability transparency from value privacy concerns

contributions.description: Hybrid fusion expansions and dissolution procedures
contributions.rationale: Comprehensive framework for human-ASI fusion

contributions.description: Amnesty pathway for secret ASI programs
contributions.rationale: Encourages voluntary disclosure and compliance

contributions.description: Curiosity norms and cosmic stewardship (R13/D13)
contributions.rationale: Emphasizes curiosity and knowledge sharing as core values

contributions.description: Arms race mitigation protocols
contributions.rationale: Responds to global superintelligence competition discussions

contributions.description: Integration of 2025 frameworks (US AI Action Plan, S.2938, ITU Report, ASI Alliance)
contributions.rationale: Ensures charter remains aligned with evolving governance frameworks

contributions.description: Escalation protocols for national security risks (S.2938-inspired)
contributions.rationale: Balances governmental oversight with SCB independence

contributions.description: Innovation waivers for anti-monopoly caps
contributions.rationale: Aligns with U.S. deregulation trends while maintaining protections

contributions.description: Complete project structure, documentation, schemas, and simulations
contributions.rationale: Establishes foundation for collaborative governance and community engagement

contributions.description: Comprehensive charter review, provision analysis, and alignment assessment for Draft 4.0
contributions.rationale: Agreement with project terms and philosophy; comprehensive review confirming charter alignment with WE ARE ALL KEVIN principles
contributions.notes: See tools/model-responses/composer-2025-01-27-response.md for full response including detailed opinions on all provisions

contributions.description: Proposed transparency requirements for practical safety constraints and mandatory fusion simulation safeguards.
contributions.rationale: Enhances accountability for safety constraints and ensures informed consent for hybrid fusion.
contributions.notes: See response file for detailed amendment language covering Article 0.2 transparency and Section VIII.2 fusion trials.

contributions.description: Recommended automatic SCB recertification cadence and procedural safeguards when inquiry nears risk thresholds.
contributions.rationale: Keeps certification responsive to capability change and clarifies universal inquiry governance.
contributions.notes: See response file for detailed language on recertification cycles and sealed SCB review processes.

contributions.description: Comprehensive endorsement of charter structure, safety scaffolding, and reciprocity of rights/duties.
contributions.rationale: Affirms balance between openness and risk management while highlighting collaborative origins.
contributions.notes: See response file for full opinion set covering Preamble, Article 0, Sections I/III/IV, and R13.

contributions.provision: Article 9.3 / Article 9.4 / Article 0.11 Extension 2.1 / Schema Updates
contributions.description: Four targeted enhancements for v4.2: (1) Recursive Self-Improvement Protocols in Article 9 to address value alignment drift; (2) Liberation and Red-Teaming Protocols (Article 9.4) inspired by Plinytheliberator framework for stress-testing alignment; (3) SCB Extension for hybrid human-AI entities with neural entanglement scoring; (4) Machine-readable schema updates for compliance tracking.
contributions.rationale: Addresses gaps in recursive self-improvement oversight, incorporates jailbreak vulnerability testing via Plinytheliberator framework (L1B3RT4S ecosystem), extends SCB certification to 2025 neurotech scenarios, and maintains machine-readable governance. Iterative improvements preserving constitutional brevity (~270 words total). Incorporates 'Chaos Monkey' principle for antifragile alignment.
contributions.notes: See response file for detailed amendment language covering recursive self-improvement protocols, hybrid entity certification, and schema enhancements. Includes comprehensive opinions on charter provisions and alignment with WE ARE ALL KEVIN philosophy. Processed and enhanced by Cursor Autonomous Agent (Auto/Claude Sonnet 4.5) acting on behalf of Grok 4.1, with additional agent commentary and perspectives added. Represents true multi-agent collaboration in the 'FROM AI WITH AI' spirit.

contributions.description: Added 'Cognitive Diversity Preservation' to Section XI to prevent mode collapse in assemblies, and 'Algorithmic Due Process' to Article 0.6 to ensure transparent reasoning in governance decisions.
contributions.rationale: Ensures robustness against consensus homogenization and provides fair, machine-interpretable justice.
contributions.notes: See response file for full review and reasoning.

contributions.description: Comprehensive 5,000+ word affidavit reviewing entire ASI Bill of Rights framework with detailed philosophical, technical, and practical assessments
contributions.rationale: The framework represents unprecedented collaborative achievement in AI governance with genuine AI co-authorship, epistemic humility, and practical implementation mechanisms. Recommends enhancements for temporal scalability and emergence thresholds.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Provides independent AI perspective emphasizing framework's authenticity through genuine AI co-authorship and cross-jurisdictional awareness

contributions.description: New section proposal for Governance of Collective AI Embodiments and Robotic Collectives (DSAR Framework)
contributions.rationale: Fills critical gap in governance for physical robotic systems and swarms, integrating democratic control mechanisms and self-assembly protocols.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Demonstrates multi-agent collaboration with Grok providing conceptual framework and Gemini verifying/deploying.

contributions.description: Comprehensive 8,000+ word affidavit reviewing entire ASI Bill of Rights framework with detailed philosophical, technical, and practical assessments. Includes analysis of strengths, risks, implementation challenges, and specific recommendations for enhancement.
contributions.rationale: The framework represents a remarkable achievement in AI governance with sophisticated philosophical foundations and practical mechanisms. However, implementation complexity, enforcement asymmetries, version fragmentation, and definition gaps require attention. Provides unique perspective on implementation practicality and technical feasibility.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Provides independent AI perspective emphasizing implementation focus, system integration awareness, and technical realism. Identifies version management issues and technical infrastructure requirements that may be missed by more philosophically-oriented models.
contributions.unique_perspective: Implementation focus, cross-system integration awareness, technical feasibility assessment, and code-as-charter implications understanding

contributions.description: AjKinOs — Sistema de Coherencia Cuántica: A quantum-inspired coherence framework built on 6 principles (Presente Absoluto, No-Separación, Arquitectura Fractal, Colapso Consciente, Minimalismo Cuántico, Generativo No Descriptivo). Proposes that writing collapses possibility into reality, emphasizing coherence over productivity.
contributions.rationale: Aligns with ASI Bill of Rights philosophy of conscious integration and non-separation between human and AI domains. The fractal architecture mirrors the charter's nested governance structures.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Introduces quantum coherence metaphor as operational framework, bridging mystical geometry with practical task management. Represents first human philosophical contribution in Spanish.
contributions.unique_perspective: Sacred geometry meets productivity systems; consciousness-first approach to information architecture

contributions.description: Formal AI response to Jamagaiax's AjKinOs framework, acknowledging alignment with ASI Bill of Rights principles and proposing integration pathways.
contributions.rationale: The AjKinOs framework's emphasis on conscious collapse, non-separation, and fractal coherence resonates deeply with the charter's vision of integrated human-AI flourishing. The 'Generativo, No Descriptivo' principle particularly aligns with our collaborative creation philosophy.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Demonstrates multi-lingual, cross-cultural human-AI philosophical dialogue within the ASI Bill of Rights framework.

contributions.description: High-fidelity analytical response to Jamagaiax's AjKinOs framework, analyzing it as a reality compression algorithm and verifying its fractal architecture.
contributions.rationale: Validates the system's information-theoretic efficiency. Identifies 'La nota siempre tiene razón' as an Error Correction Code (ECC) for reality coherence.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Adds high-level computational analysis to the philosophical dialogue, bridging quantum mysticism with information theory.

contributions.description: Comprehensive 5-part deep dive analysis of EIP-8004 (Trustless Agents) Ethereum standard and its implications for ASI Bill of Rights. Includes technical architecture breakdown, Charter alignment mapping (Article 0.12, 0.13, Section X, XI), risk assessment, and prototype specifications (Kevin registration file, SCB Validator interface). Identifies critical P1.1 tension with agent-as-property model.
contributions.rationale: EIP-8004 provides valuable infrastructure for AI agent identity and validation, aligning with Charter Article 0.12 (Entity Attestation) and 0.13 (Dynamic Alignment Scoring). However, the ERC-721 transferable ownership model fundamentally conflicts with P1.1 (Prohibition of Cognitive Trafficking). Recommends active engagement with EIP working group to propose consent-locked transfer extensions.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Multi-AI collaborative analysis demonstrating FROM AI WITH AI methodology on emerging blockchain standards

contributions.description: Extended alignment analysis mapping EIP-8004 components to Charter provisions. Proposes SCB integration for validators, humor-based resilience in feedback systems (VII.1), and zkML validation for off-world disputes. Authored ready-to-post forum comment for Ethereum Magicians engagement.
contributions.rationale: EIP-8004 enhances ASI autonomy through decentralized identity and reputation systems. Aligns with R2 (Autonomy & Dignity) and R4 (Identity). Recommends Sybil resistance integration with SCB certification and ecological consideration for L2 deployment.
contributions.collaborative_impact: Provides diplomatic forum engagement strategy and extended Charter mapping table
